title: 112_s3508
content: The "SCORE for Small Business Act of 2012" authorizes appropriations for the SCORE program to support small businesses. The funding amounts are specified for fiscal years 2013 to 2015. The Small Business Act is amended to define the SCORE program and outline volunteer requirements for participants. The Small Business Act is amended to define the SCORE program, which provides counseling, mentoring, coaching, and low-cost education workshops for small business owners. Volunteers participating in the program will utilize tools and resources from other organizations as needed. The SCORE program ensures volunteers are trained for successful client interactions and sets outreach goals for diverse communities. The SCORE program, in partnership with the SCORE Association, aims to provide services to individuals in rural areas, economically disadvantaged communities, and other underserved communities through electronic and web-based initiatives, chapter expansion, partnerships, and volunteer skill development. The SCORE Association is required to submit an annual report detailing the number of individuals counseled or trained and the hours of counseling provided. The SCORE program, in partnership with the SCORE Association, provides counseling services to individuals and small businesses. Privacy requirements prohibit the disclosure of personal information of those receiving assistance. The SCORE program, in partnership with the SCORE Association, provides counseling services to individuals and small businesses. Privacy requirements prohibit the disclosure of personal information without consent, except in specific circumstances such as court orders or financial audits. The Administrator must issue regulations to establish standards for financial audit disclosures and conducting client surveys with maximum privacy protection. The regulations must ensure maximum privacy protection for client surveys and use of client information, with approval required from the Inspector General until the regulations take effect. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Small Business Act is amended to replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in certain sections. Additionally, the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009 is amended to define the term "SCORE program" and replace "Service Corps of Retired Executives" with "SCORE program" in a specific subsection.
